intro: Acranthera monantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved starwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers, and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are usually white or pale blue. Acranthera monantha is often found in open habitats and is adapted to withstand dry conditions.
